section.title: Why support?
section.para: eXist started as a spare time project in 2001. Only a small part of my work on eXist has been covered by different academic projects in which I have been involved. The rest is spare time. eXist itself is not directly supported by academic funding. It is real free software in the sense that it depends on the commitment of volunteers.

The user community of eXist has been continously growing throughout the past two years. Maintaining and developing the software is more and more becoming a full-time job. This is only possible as long as my "official" projects allow me to invest enough time into eXist. I would be happy if I could finance at least a part of my work time and stay independent enough to continue the project, to pay for equipment, internet connections and travel.

listitem.para: First of all, the best way to support eXist is to contribute code, bug-fixes, test cases, documentation and the like. If you're not a programmer, there are other ways to support the team: e.g. by writing tutorials or howtos, or simply by spreading the news about eXist.
Donate any amount you find appropriate using PayPal or Kagi. Donations help me as maintainer and main developer of eXist to keep the project alive, to fix bugs and implement new features.
Making a donation also assumes direct, higher priority support by the maintainer of the software.

I'm willing to offer the implementation of extra features and modifications, if my time frame permits it. Just contact me for a possible arrangement. The results of such work should go back into eXist.
If none of the alternatives described is appropriate for you, don't hesitate to contact me. We can surely find another arrangement.
Donate using PayPal (low fees, but requires registration)
